title: Trump 'holding EU HOSTAGE to Brexit & trying to redraw Europe map with Putin', MP claims
text:
Trump 'holding EU HOSTAGE to Brexit & trying to redraw Europe map with Putin', MP claims Trump 'holding EU HOSTAGE to Brexit & trying to redraw Europe map with Putin', MP claims DONALD Trump and Vladimir Putin are set to “draw the map of Europe to their own design” amid EU chaos in the aftermath of Brexit, according to a senior French politician. PUBLISHED: 00:01, Wed, Feb 8, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:09, Wed, Feb 8, 2017 GETTY Putin and Trump are set to exert their influence in determining Europe's future, claims Mr Raffarin 
Following Theresa May’s historic visit to the White House last month, Trump is likely to try to undermine and weaken the EU after he promised to seek a trade agreement with Britain “very quickly”. 
He hailed the UK’s “smart” decision to leave the crumbling Brussels bloc and Jean-Pierre Raffarin, a former French prime minister, has claimed Trump’s foreign policy could rock EU stability. Related articles Mr Trump and Mr Putin are likely to try to draw the map of Europe to their design Jean-Pierre Raffarin 
He said: “The meeting between Mrs May and Mr Trump is something which affects us. 
“The difficulty with Mr Trump is that he is completely unpredictable, we have to see what he is going to do. 
"But we are receiving signals which we find worrying.” GETTY The claims were made by former French PM Jean-Pierre Raffarin during a visit to London 
Mr Raffarin does not share Trump’s positive outlook on Brexit but rejected claims that France wants to “punish” Britain for voting to leave. 
“The new agreement [for Britain] will not be as good as the previous one, but we need to reassure the British and also the Europeans that an agreement will be in their best interest.” Being President Trump: Key Moments Fri, February 3, 2017 Getty Images 1 of 14 Trump signs an order to review the Dodd-Frank Wall Street to roll back financial regulations of the Obama era. 
His colleague Valérie Pécresse, President of the Ile-de-France region, confirmed France wanted to maintain good relations with the UK and denied France wanted to see a hard Brexit. 
“It’s not a question of punishing Britain for its vote. But it is a question of trying to keep a strong European Union. 
"If we want to keep a strong EU, it means that people who vote out cannot have all of the advantages and yet none of the duties.” 
Mr Raffarin, the chairman of the French Senate’s EU Committee, also fears Trump’s preference for bilateral trade deals, rather than multilateral agreements, could have a huge impact on relations between Brussels and Washington. 
“The US wants to do bilateral deals with its friends. 
“We don’t accept this approach, we are united in the European Union and we must stay together. GETTY Donald Trump spoke with Putin in a historic phone call last month 
“Mr Trump is trying to hold the EU hostage to Brexit.” 
The French Senator went on to suggest Russian president Vladimir Putin could side with Trump over a push for more bilateral trade deals, claiming: "With Russia we need to wait and see, but Mr Putin sees Europe in terms of Nato and he too sees the logic of bilateral relationships for his benefit. 
"Mr Trump and Mr Putin are likely to try to draw the map of Europe to their design.” Related articles
